channel.title: Buzzing on Quora
channel.description: 用中文浏览Quora上的热门回答

item.title: What are some communication practices that organizations are getting wrong? @CWaltersPhD, business and branding expert, shares 5 critical errors many businesses are making. https://t.co/sBxgQBcTRM https://t.co/mLUbXU9yJP

What common mistakes do people make when writing speeches? Nathan Miller, founder and CEO at @MillerInkLA, shares the 3 C's and 3 S's for a flawless speechwriting framework. https://t.co/fHEm1ZgQg9 https://t.co/DqLTtDbTo0

Looking for a way to integrate your priorities into your life?@AnnaDKornick, time management coach & Head of Community at @getclockwise, explains, "We often start in the wrong place." To read her 2 step process for making change, read her full piece here: https://t.co/2fPcLaUyZh https://t.co/h85PQzZtKu
Transnistria is in the news, but what is it? History teacher and Quora contributor Dan Torcea has a 30 second summary: https://t.co/JJT1azs0VP
What does counting on your fingers have to do with the number of degrees in a circle? Scholar and Quora contributor Jason Almendra explains: https://t.co/XUOLEuzUnd
Do businesses have an obligation to care about the mental health of employees? Kara Govro, HR Legal Expert, shares 3 reasons why they should. https://t.co/3lLJ8z2xU8 https://t.co/Y2pNSs2OME

What is the first thing you teach in media training? Nathan Miller, founder and CEO at @MillerInkLA, says you have to steer the discussion back to the main points you want to get across. Read his full answer here: https://t.co/OE6MIFsgQT https://t.co/2XGuqrT4Cb
What do successful HR departments have in common? Kara Govro, Chief HR Legal Expert, shares 4 key elements. See her full piece here: https://t.co/jqCOdryVjs https://t.co/NexUkYbeaL

Who's working on their summer bod? Professor and textbook author Ken Saladin shows what's happening on a microscopic level in your muscles: https://t.co/0biFGr10xT Don't miss the comments from exercise physiologists! https://t.co/dYWYmj0iC5

How does the The James Webb Space Telescope produce color images from infrared cameras, which don't see visible light? Let a science nerd give you the details: https://t.co/WTCvARcc9I #UnfoldTheUniverse
Is it worth learning new technology as you age? @lawrencekosick, president and co-founder of @GetSetUp_org, says yes! Here are six reasons why: https://t.co/UyHMTzJiIQ https://t.co/EfvPGmXI83
How do real time locating systems work? Mohammed Smadi, CEO at PenguinIN Inc., breaks it down in his answer here: https://t.co/AvWBS0Nhwt https://t.co/aPzXru2U96

How can corporations be more socially responsible? Today’s social responsibility work must be embedded and connected to the core of what an organization does. @emilykanemiller, founder + CEO @EthosGiving, shares her expert insights: https://t.co/UuoyIqZPVq https://t.co/8iu6EjisEo

How does having access to clean water empower communities? @sarahaware, founder of @WellAwareWorld and @WellBeyondWater, shares how water scarcity is a burden on women and girls and a barrier toward education and economic equality. Read her full piece: https://t.co/BvtVPAYOPk https://t.co/1n101ETELZ

What is it like to write/direct/produce a movie? @KentMoran, actor, filmmaker, and business owner shares his experience, "Intense, amazing, fun, stressful, educational, emotional, and more all at once." https://t.co/LfMWFJ8i0u https://t.co/o3jgq2nV5h

What progress has been made around climate change? Emma Varvaloucas (@heyemmavarv), host of What Could Go Right? podcast, shares data based insights here: https://t.co/L215VbduPy https://t.co/t4e8XXDkFt
Have you heard of the Batman Equation? The creator of the equation explains how he did it: https://t.co/rKqdeZOOke https://t.co/v1v1wfVBR5
How is the chip shortage impacting the auto market? Gurpreet Singh, General Manager of Auto Loans at @creditkarma explains: https://t.co/m6oBdPtFok

Do we have conclusive evidence that humans are the root cause of climate change? @CarbonBrief, award-winning journalism on climate change, policy & energy, shares their analysis. https://t.co/c59rcfSnOC

How can I influence decision makers at work? Lane Shackleton (@lshackleton), Lead Product & Design at @coda_hq, says, "to do it well, I find you need the right framing and approaches in place." for the rest of his advice, read his full answer here: https://t.co/IEhQgOc2qJ https://t.co/G49Z0aav6J
This question needs some better answers. Who has an opinion they'd like to share in more than 280 characters? https://t.co/SFAiM6agCB

What's the best advice for brands that are rebranding? Hunter Ray Barker (@stuntmanhunter), Co-Founder @BullfrogAgency & SEO Company, shares 3 tips to help ensure you’re rebranding your business correctly. https://t.co/OT51PClWZm https://t.co/ZK8PDJ01DQ
What is the significance of the #SummerSolstice2022? Physicist Raziman TV explains the astronomical significance: https://t.co/5Td6FvMf6r
If you could go back in time and change one event in the history of the world, what would you change? https://t.co/dMm2C4DSbL

What is one thing that everyone should eliminate if they want to live longer? @lawrencekosick, President and Co-Founder at @GetSetUp_org, shares five areas of your health you should consider for a more substantial life. https://t.co/uTZSihgfOd https://t.co/zwxBlberfH
Is it actually a good time to sell a car and buy a new one? Gurpreet Singh, General Manager of Auto Loans at @creditkarma, shares his expert advice. https://t.co/7KJh0Zo36u https://t.co/G82pDCmOiu
Want another take on how to keep customers happy? Check out this piece by Joel McKelvey, VP of Product and Partner Marketing at @sisudata. https://t.co/VqCDWqtJ9G https://t.co/cmfpLTIWt1
How is the chip shortage impacting the car buying market? Gurpreet Singh, General Manager of Auto Loans at @creditkarma, explains. https://t.co/m6oBdPLgMU https://t.co/s597ry3qAM

Which classes are better to take in high school, International Baccalaureate (IB) or Advanced Placement (AP)? Kristen Moon Founder & CEO at @moon_prep, gives her expert opinion. https://t.co/LGOh4RtVi3 https://t.co/03EKPUF5pA

Human Rights have come farther along than you think! Emma Varvaloucas (@heyemmavarv), host of What Could Go Right? podcast, shares how far different countries have come in recent years. https://t.co/9m7kLmJ1qa https://t.co/X3YI0y9DTz

How are climatological trends different in the Sierra Nevadas different than other mountain ranges? Andrew Schwartz (@snow_d0c), Atmospheric scientist specializing in snow @UCBerkeley, Lead Scientist at UC Berkeley Central Sierra Snow Laboratory, answers. https://t.co/HWgu1w902t https://t.co/vvjDsywfZD
What are some common misconceptions about applying for an auto loan? Gurpreet Singh, General Manager of Auto Loans at @creditkarma, debunks 5 myths. https://t.co/vORE0ZRiN4 https://t.co/O4W0QmzRS3
This hairy frogfish asks, "Is it the weekend yet?" By Harry Strachan, Quora contributor and wildlife photographer. https://t.co/QgsQerFnE7 https://t.co/k58e24oBaS
Are there any open problems (unsolved problems) in the field of algebraic number theory? @AlonAmit runs down a list! Anyone feeling ambitious? https://t.co/vCgTxsKdmi
When did getting older really begin to bother you? President and Co-Founder at GetSetUp, @lawrencekosick, shares his insights on the aging process. https://t.co/y9kqMidzSw https://t.co/d3KkEZalSS

How can you apply lessons from different careers to the one you have? @CWaltersPhD, business & branding mentor, corporate training, shares five questions you should ask yourself about each job you've had. https://t.co/w1bDatxW3d https://t.co/s4Q9iizh8I
What inspired you to want to fix poverty in Kenya? Founder and CEO @techlitafrica, Nelly Cheboi (@nelly_cheboi), explains. https://t.co/lR3ncBaPhm https://t.co/GxKlKhml8C

What does the average day look like at the Central Sierra Snow Laboratory? Andrew Schwartz (@snow_d0c), Atmospheric scientist specializing in snow @UCBerkeley, shares what weather scientists do all day. https://t.co/rd7JL0a7Ha https://t.co/hIspfPQoTH
Has the Methuselah Tree, an ancient bristlecone pine, been dethroned as the world's oldest tree? Quora contributor and archaeologist Colleen Anne Coyle has the details: https://t.co/5b0MbpyKH8
What are your top five pieces of advice when handling communication during a crisis? Nathan Miller, Founder & CEO @MillerInkLA, answers. https://t.co/4B1QOl7hjD https://t.co/dOOPClUdkX

Why aren’t we more accurate at predicting the weather? Andrew Schwartz (@snow_d0c), Atmospheric scientist specializing in snow @UCBerkeley, explains why. https://t.co/DEwKemZc1i https://t.co/zi8zznOODD

Are food assistance programs in the US doing enough? Jack Griffin, Founder and CEO of @FoodFinderUS, shares his thoughts on what programs are doing right and what they can do better. https://t.co/6PT9cG072w https://t.co/Po8rRs9qqw
What are the benefits of an easy, flexible, three-step tool for making decisions? @MichelleSegar PhD, author of The Joy Choice, shares her expertise. https://t.co/7jEMJybOtN https://t.co/OOyTIF5KW1

Ever wondered what it's like to work at Quora? Check out this @builtin profile of senior leadership, find out what makes Quora special, and get a little glimpse of what the future holds! https://t.co/snV7PHvm3A
When is the sun like caramel corn? Physics teacher and Quora contributor Philip Freeman explains it's all about the H-alpha filter: https://t.co/q10rtvPWQ4 https://t.co/HqLOXA5EP5
How did sunflowers, a new-world plant domesticated by Native Americans, become one of the main agricultural products of Ukraine? It's a bit of a Johnny Appleseed story! https://t.co/F0r5KKPsPj
Who is the victim in the Amber Heard v. Johnny Depp trial? @NeamaRahmani, President of @WestCoastTrial answers. https://t.co/qYf2PveCJb https://t.co/vDpZgs0Hoj

In a time of war, is there any progress in the global movement toward peace as a norm? Emma Varvaloucas (@heyemmavarv), host of What Could Go Right? podcast explains why we should hold some optimism. https://t.co/MF343g7dsY https://t.co/4jWE1e6Q7c
Is job hopping seen as good or bad by employers? @CWaltersPhD, business & branding mentor, corporate training, shares her expert advice. https://t.co/zrZKCUXpmU https://t.co/hjZzDfBs6o

Why are there so many people who are food insecure? Jack Griffin, Founder and CEO of @FoodFinderUS, shares how current events have made food insecurities even worse. https://t.co/a1tRbt2Thf https://t.co/SRZhiM2DwJ
